messageBody:
Hey David,

Thanks for the reply. I am trying what you suggest, and it appears to be working...but not working as intended. It is still running all of the tests.

I am doing:

Result r = (new JUnitCore()).run(Request.method(Class.forName("my.package.CalculatorTest"), "testAdd"));

And it's acting like I'm just doing:

Result r = (new JUnitCore()).run(Class.forName("my.package.CalculatorTest"));

in that it's still running every test in my.package.CalculatorTest. From what you said and what I've read in the javadoc, this should be working...but either I'm doing something wrong or it's not working. Can anyone confirm that using run(Request) actually works? Thanks again.

BTW, I'm using JUnit 4.5

From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of David Saff
Sent: Thursday, October 16, 2008 10:38 AM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [junit] How to run individual test case within a test class from command line(JUnit 4.x)


nom_ah,

This should work (I haven't compiled it):

new JUnitCore.run(Request.method(class, methodName));

Let me know.

David Saff

On Wed, Oct 15, 2008 at 1:44 PM, nom_ah <rhuff@...<mailto:rhuff%40slickedit.com>> wrote:
> I am wondering if it is possible to run an individual test case from a
> test class from the command line using JUnitCore? I have searched
> high and low to find an answer to this question, and unfortunately the
> only information I have been able to obtain is how to run an
> individual test from within the Eclipse GUI (or by using the @Ignore
> annotation and recompiling source).
>
> Is this possible? If so, how? If not, is it possible by using
> something other than JUnitCore? Just to be super clear, say I have a
> test class CalculatorTest with several test methods. I want to be
> able to run CalculatorTest.multiply, not just all of the methods in
> CalculatorTest.
>
> Thanks in advance.
>
>
